title: British Airways plane fills with smoke at 30,000ft and has to make an emergency landing
text:
Four British Airways crew members were taken to hospital after an aeroplane filled with smoke at 30,000 feet.

All of the plane's 165 passengers were safely evacuated after the aircraft's emergency landing in Basle, Switzerland.

The Airbus 320 had been travelling from Bari, Italy, to Gatwick, but was forced to make the emergency stop when the jet became enveloped in smoke.

Four British Airways crew members were taken to hospital after an aeroplane filled with smoke at 30,000 feet. Pictured are fire crews on board the flight after the emergency landing in Basle, Switzerland

British Airways then sent another plane to pick up the stranded passengers and return them to the UK.

One of the passengers told the Sun: 'The cabin started to smell of smoke and then we could see smoke and the crew were looking a bit worried so the captain came over the Tannoy and announced we were making an emergency landing.'

A spokesman for Basle-Mulhouse airport said: 'A British Airways plane made an emergency landing after the pilot reported smoke on board.

Emergency services attended and four crew members were taken to hospital as a precaution.'

The Airbus 320 had been travelling from Bari, Italy, to Gatwick, but was forced to make the emergency stop when the jet became enveloped in smoke. Stock picture

And at the beginning of August another British Airways plane had to make an emergency landing after it also filled with smoke.

Terrified passengers were forced to evacuate the plane via inflatable slides after it made an emergency landing in Valencia.

Three of the 183 people on board the Airbus A321 were taken to hospital.

Footage from that incident shows a panicked air hostess on the phone while terrified passengers walk around.
description: The British Airways plane filled with smoke and had to make an emergency landing in Basle, Switzerland. Another plane was sent to pick up the 165 stranded passengers.
